turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I think he was sleeping with Wendy, too.

turns.speaker: GILLETT
turns.text: You may be right.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Are you serious?

turns.speaker: GILLETT
turns.text: That's history, Fletch. You owe us nine hundred and eighteen dollars.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Wait a minute! Our problems might be solved.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Damn... lost again. Sorry.

turns.speaker: GILLETT
turns.text: This is no joke. If some kind of payment isn't made, we're going to have to contact the paper and garnish your wages.

turns.speaker: GILLETT
turns.text: Cash. I'm impressed.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Found it in a cab. That's a grand. Apply the difference to next month.

turns.speaker: GILLETT
turns.text: Till then.

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: Good evening.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I like your outfit. You got the fifty grand and the plane ticket?

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: Why don't you check it out for yourself, Mr. Nugent?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Because I trust you, Alan. By the way, the name's Fletcher. I.M. Fletcher. I write a newspaper column under the name Jane Doe.

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Read this, please.

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: Wait a second --

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Cut the crap and read it.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: He is lifting Stanwyk's two attaché cases.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Pretty hefty. Keep reading.

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: '...with his legal wife, the former Sally Ann Cavanaugh.'

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: He doesn't read my stuff well.  'Sally Ann and Alan were married four years ago and never divorced, making Stanwyk a bigamist even in Utah. Stanwyk is also traveling with three million dollars in cash, the result of Gail Stanwyk's conversion of Boyd Aviation stock. Mrs. Stanwyk believed the money was to be used to purchase property in Utah, but it wasn't; a fact that can be confirmed by realtor James Swarthout of Provo.'  That was stupid, Alan.

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: I'd have been long gone.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Ahem.  'Sally Ann can confirm all this when the police pick her up at the Airport Marriott.'

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: Bravo, Mr. Fletcher.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: The thing that really tipped it off for me was something your wife said to me while we were in bed together.

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: And what was that?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: How similar in build you and I are. Then I figured it. You bump me off, throw me in the car, and burn me up.

turns.speaker: MR. STANWYK
turns.text: I was already prepared to commit one murder. What makes you think I won't commit two?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Whoops.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm Harry S. Truman from Casewell Insurance Underwriters.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Harry S. Truman?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: My parents were great fans of the former President.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Isn't that nice. Good man. Showed the Japs a thing or two.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Sure did. Dropped the big one on them.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Dropped two big ones. Real fighter. You're in the insurance line, Harry?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Well, I'm fully covered.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I don't doubt it, Mr. Stanwyk. Actually, my company is the sub- insurer of the subsidiary carriers of a policy held by Alan Stanwyk, who I believe is your son.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Yes. Where you from, Harry?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: California. San Berdoo. Utah's part of my route. Can I ask you a few questions?

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Come on in.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Regulations, Mr. Stanwyk. And you and your wife, named....

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Velma.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Velma. You and Velma are the parents of Alan Stanwyk, Beverly Hills, California, executive vice president of Boyd Aviation?

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Check.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Okay.  Now, the last time you saw your son was when?

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Oh, about ten days ago.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Ten days ago?

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: That's right. Alan comes by every three weeks or so.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Isn't that nice. Since when?

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Since he moved to L.A.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Forgive me now for seeming personal, but we understand that there is a lady friend he sees here in Provo.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: What the hell does this have to do with insurance?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Trust me, sir. It's a comprehensive policy.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Well, you can forget about that lady friend business, Alan's the most loyal husband a girl could have. He dotes on that bride of his.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Has he?

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Boy, what the hell's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Then he has.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Course he has. That's his wife.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: He sighs.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: And they're still married... Alan and Sally Ann.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Of course they are.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Lets see, it was before he moved to L.A... four years April.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Mrs. Stanwyk, may I borrow this picture. I promise to send it back to you. It's routine, really. The actuarial people need to --

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm calling the police. Then I'm leaving. You wait here for them.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Away. I think it might take you a while to get your life back together. You don't need me around.  Don't go back in there.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: I really creamed the sonofabitch, didn't I?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You sure did.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: John Ultramalensky, right?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: God, I haven't seen you since the wedding.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Gee, I must have been shit-faced at your wedding, I don't --

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: Not mine, stupid. Yours.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: GAIL
turns.text: I couldn't sit home and play the mournful widow anymore, and the police didn't need me, so I tried watching a Lakers game on TV, but the announcer talked to fast and I couldn't understand a lot of what was happening, so I figured if I came down here maybe you could explain the rules to me, and besides, I missed you.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: Hi Sam. Hi Fletch.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Hi Gummy. Hows the eye?

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: Its okay. The cops did it.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: They busted me last week.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: They bust you every week.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: I know. I got bad luck or something.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm the Sufi.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: Fletch?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Don't call me Fletch. Don't look at me. Lie back down. We'll talk.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Cops are here. I can smell them. They're after me. Lie down, Gum.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: Why are they after you?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Because I'm a newspaper reporter and I'm nailing Chief Cummings as the source for drugs on the beach. You're in big trouble, Gummy.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Fat Sam is turning state's evidence.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: He wrote me a nice deposition. He says he just received the drugs. You did the selling.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: I didn't sell nothing! I didn't sell nothing! I just carried the drugs from the Chief to Sam.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Sure you did.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: Fletch, I never sold nothing.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Twenty years.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Where does the Chief get the drugs?

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: I dunno. Somewhere in South America, I forget.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Rio de Janeiro, maybe?

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: Maybe, Fletch. Is that Brazil?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: That's Brazil.

turns.speaker: GUMMY
turns.text: Yeah. Maybe.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Wait here for me, Gummy.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: We can't talk about it here.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Because we can't.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Are you on a scavenger hunt of some kind?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: I want you to come to my house. Then we'll talk.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I think you've got the wrong gal, fella.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: I'll give you a thousand dollars cash just to come to my house and listen to the proposition. If you reject the proposition, you keep the thousand, and your mouth shut.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Will this proposition entail my dressing up as Tina Turner?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: It is nothing of a sexual nature I assure you.  One thousand, just to listen. I don't see how you could turn that down Mr...

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Nugent. Ted Nugent.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Alan Stanwyk.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Charmed.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Then I found out Hopalong Cassidy had shot himself in the game room. That just blew it for me.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Hopalong Cassidy. Killed himself here. Bow and arrow. Strange.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I don't work for you yet, assface. Don't talk to me like that.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Come inside.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Here's my proposition, Mr. Nugent.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm all ears.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: I want you to murder me.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You don't look sick, Mr. Stanwyk.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: I don't feel sick. Not yet. They tell me it'll start getting bad in about a month. After that... well, I'd rather not be around for it.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Why don't you try suicide?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: My company has taken out a very large insurance policy on me. And I have a wife. Suicide would nullify my insurance. Murder does not.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: So why pick me?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: You're a drifter, a -- pardon the expression -- beach bum. No one would notice if you disappeared. I've watched you for a couple weeks.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Maybe I'm just on vacation.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Not with the scum you hang out with. I've watched. I've thought. Its a perfect scheme. I even have a perfect escape plan for you.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Did it ever occur to you that I might not want to kill you?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: I've got fifty thousand dollars says you will.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm still here.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: I want it done Thursday evening, around eight PM. My wife will be off to the club for a committee meeting. It's the staff's night off.  These will be open.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Wouldn't they normally be locked?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Sometimes yes, sometimes no. The staff usually forgets.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I have the same problem with my help.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: I will be here in the room, waiting for you. The safe will be open and there will be fifty thousand dollars in it. You will be wearing rubber gloves. Do you own rubber gloves?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I rent them. Monthly lease, with an option to buy.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: In this drawer....

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Very good. My .357. Use it and no one can trace it to you. The room will be in some disarray.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: So it looks like a burglary attempt. You catch me. I get the gun, and shoot you.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Precisely. Are you a good shot?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: What's the difference? The noise'll kill you first.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Get me on the first shot, if you can.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I don't think you'll have to worry about that.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Do you have a passport?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Sure, all drifters do.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Fine. After you kill me, take the Jaguar. The keys will be in the glove compartment.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Take it where?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: LAX. Go to the Pan Am desk. There will be a ticket waiting for you.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Where am I going?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Rio. Flight 306. Departs at eleven PM.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: They serve dinner on the flight?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: It'll be a first class-ticket. I'm sure you'll enjoy the ride. I would recommend staying down there at least a year, Mr. Nugent.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You've certainly thought this out, haven't you?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: I am not someone who leaves a great deal to chance, Mr. Nugent.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You sure those doors will be open?

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Yes. All you provide are the gloves, the passport, and the aim. I'll take care of everything else.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: The gun, the money, the tickets, and the dying.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You sure got the hard part.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: What do you say, Mr. Nugent? You'll be doing me and my family a great service.

turns.speaker: STANWYK
turns.text: Will you kill me?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Yo!

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Can I steal you for a minute?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Only if you promise not to return me.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: 'Magic' today, huh?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Kareem's in the wash. I need a favor.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Shoot.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Don't say shoot, okay.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Did you hear something?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Not me.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Me neither. See what we've got on a guy named Alan Stanwyk, okay? I need it right away.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: W-Y-K no 'c.' I'll be down in a minute.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: No problem, boss.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: 'Mr. Stanwyk, of Provo, Utah, is a former commercial pilot.'

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Married Boyd Aviation. He's no dummy, that's serious coin.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: 'Stanwyk's parents, Marvin and Velma Stanwyk, also of Provo, were unable to attend the wedding.'

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Not our kind of people, you understand.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Spot right here.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: You doing a story on this guy?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: '...Stanwyk, blahblahblah, with internist Doctor Joseph Dolen.'

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I wonder if that's his doctor.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Only one way to find out.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Nothing on Gail Stanwyk, nothing on Jim Swarthout. But I did ---

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: That's okay, Lar. I gotta put this on the back burner for a while.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Did you say cops?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: That's one thing I did find. It's from last month, so it was in the unsorted pile.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: My hero.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Nothing to it.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I overheard it. He thinks you're completely out of control, he said he was gonna can you as soon as he got the story. If I were you, I'd just chuck it, Fletch. Screw him. Let him eat three full pages on Sunday.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You kidding? I got an unbelievable story here, Lar. Un-believable. Jesus. It's the cops, I know it. The Chief! And they're all over Frank.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I just thought... sure.  Sally Ann Cavanaugh.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Check every hotel in L.A. Start with the ones near the airport. Yeah. He's about to leave the country with her. Thanks, Lar.

turns.speaker: VELMA
turns.text: Cute young thing, too.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm sorry?

turns.speaker: VELMA
turns.text: His bride. Cute as a button.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You've met her?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Of course, his wife's name is Sally Ann Cavanaugh?

turns.speaker: VELMA
turns.text: Cute thing.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Do you happen to have a picture of Alan and his wife?

turns.speaker: VELMA
turns.text: Oh, we've got lots of pictures. Let me show you some.

turns.speaker: VELMA
turns.text: She's cute as a button.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: How long have they been married?

turns.speaker: VELMA
turns.text: Oh, that's all right, I've got lots more. Want to see the reception?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: No, thank you.

turns.speaker: VELMA
turns.text: How about Marvin's sixty-fifth birthday party?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I haven't seen you since the wedding, Jeez, you look great.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I do? Oh, isn't that sweet, thank you. I have to confess something to you. I must have been pretty plowed at your wedding. I really don't have the faintest idea who you are.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Huh? No, not my wedding. Yours.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Oh, mine! Thank God.  Actually, that doesn't make it any better, does it? Are you a friend of Alan's?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: We used to fly together. I'm... John.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: John! You used to fly together!

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: John who?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: John Ultrarelamensky.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry. It's a beautiful name, really.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: It's Scotch-Rumanian.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: That's a strange combination.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: So were my parents.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Mind if I keep practicing? I need to work on my ground stroke a little.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Damn, I thought I had that one.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You should play with much larger tennis balls. So how's Alan?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: What are you asking me for? He's so busy lately I hardly see him. And he's been so preoccupied.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Preoccupied with what?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Oh, personal stuff. Look! I hit one!

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Why do you keep doing this?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I love the outfits.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Stay!  I must be having an off day. I'm really a fabulous player.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I have this effect on lots of women.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I bet you do.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Say, the reason I asked about Alan is that I bumped into him this morning and you know what I can't figure out?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Alan's in Utah.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I can't figure out why I went to Utah for the morning.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Okay. I'm delighted to have someone to talk to, and you're very cute, so I'm very flattered, but I'm also very married so you may as well forget -- You are trying to hit on me, aren't you?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm such a heel. How'd you guess?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: If I had a nickel for every one of Alan's flyboy buddies who tried to pick me up, I'd be a rich woman.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You are a rich woman.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: See what I mean?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: What's he doing in Utah?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: None of your business, now go away. You're throwing my game off.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: It's John. John...  Znhcneelsky.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: John Ultramalensky?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I was hoping you'd say that.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Uh... I'm just out of the shower.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Can I borrow your towel for a minute?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I'm sorry, I'm just surprised to see you. I didn't think... What do you want?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I ordered lunch.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: You ordered it here?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Well, I knew this is where my mouth would be.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Down boy.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I really should change.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: No, I think you should stay the same wonderful person you are today.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I mean put clothes on.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Here, take mine.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Have you gotten cuter since I last saw you?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Lunch...

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: God...

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: All this goes on Underhill's bill?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I saved his life during the war.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: You were in the war?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: No. He was. I got him out.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: 'I've been so many places in my life and times. I've sung a lot of songs, I've made some bad rhymes...'

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: It's amazing.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: 'I've acted out my life on stages, with ten thousand people watching...'

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Your bone structure, shoulders, neck...

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: 'But we're alone now, and I'm singing this song for you.'

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Just like Alan. It's freaky.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Can I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Depends on the question.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Are you still in love with Alan?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: No.  I mean, 'no you can't ask me that.' I mean, ask me something else.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Why'd you let me in?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Because I'm bored. Oh, that sounds terrible, doesn't it. I'm sorry. If it makes you feel any better, I also let you in because I'm hungry.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Thanks, I feel much better. Listen, if you're so bored, why didn't you go to Utah with Alan?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Utah is not exactly a cure for boredom.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Good point.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Oh, listen to me. I've never even been there and look what I say about it. Anyway, I know there'd be nothing for me to do. I don't even know anybody there.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: What about his parents?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: He never sees them and I never met them.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: How come?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Thanks for the great time.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Long story.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'll be leaving now, Mrs. Stanwyk.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I think you should call me Gail, now.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Gail. I hope this won't embarrass you in any way. I think Underhill's a yutz, you won't have any trouble with him.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Why did you do it?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: A four hundred dollar lunch tab!

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I'll cover it. You have any other surprises?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Yeah. My name's not John Ultramalensky and I wasn't at your wedding.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Who.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Irwin Fletcher. I write a newspaper column under the name Jane Doe.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: So, your husband hired me to kill him. That's the truth.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: That's what I want to know.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: He told me he was dying of cancer. Not True. That ranch you thought you were paying for in Utah? Not true.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: How do you know about that?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: He's a bad guy, Mrs. Stanwyk. Gail. I think he's involved in something very big and very bad.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: What does all this mean?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Have you ever heard the name Jim Swarthout?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Swarthout. Yes. He's the man who sold us the ranch in --

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Wrong. He sold you $3,000 worth of scrub brush.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: But I've seen the deed.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You saw a forgery.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Here's this dog that tried to eat me. Here's my motel. Here's the car I rented...

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Stop it.  Are you saying my husband is defrauding me?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I don't know. All I know is that he told me a lot of things and so far not one of them has been true.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: No. You can't. Look, I know you don't know me from Adam, but you've got to trust me.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Trust you? I may seem a little goofy at times, but I'm not a complete Bozo, you know.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Just give me twenty-four hours. Please. Someone almost killed me today. People are not being nice lately, and I don't want you getting hurt. I think you're terrific. Are you a Laker fan?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: No... I've got to go to Mr. Underhill...

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'll take you to a game.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm talking about how much I'd like to take you to a Laker game.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Wait a second. What am I supposed to do for twenty-four hours?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Act natural.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I was afraid you'd say that.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: If you need me, call the paper. Hand me that extra bottle okay?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: What's wrong, Gail?

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I decided I was going to tell my husband about you today.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: But first I called the Hall of Records in Provo. They checked on the deed. You're telling the truth. A minute later Alan came in the room and asked me why I was shaking.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I've never lied to him before.  It's the first time he's ever lied to me. He was just as convincing as when he says 'I love you.'

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I think you better sit down.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Oh God, I hate things that start like that....

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Gail, please.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: What is this....

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I checked. There was no divorce.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Are you telling me my husband is a bigamist???

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm telling you he's not your husband at all.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: And they're leaving the country tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Bastard.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I don't have all the pieces yet, but I'm close. I'll know tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I'm calling the police. Right now.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You can't do that.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Don't tell me I can't --

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: They're trying to kill me!

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I'm terrified.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Come here.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: Don't worry, I can take it.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: You shouldn't be here.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I want to hear this.

turns.speaker: MRS. STANWYK
turns.text: I thought you had this all figured out. Good going 'Irwin.'

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Don't ever call me 'Irwin,' okay?

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Excuse me sir. Are you a guest of the club?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Yes, I'm with the Underhills.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: They just left, sir.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: They'll be back. He had to go in for a urinalysis.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Would you care for a drink while you're waiting? I can put it on the Underhill bill.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Great. I'll have a Bloody Mary and a steak sandwich.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Very good sir.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Hi, where's Mrs. Stanwyk?

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: In her cabana, sir.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Oh, that's right. She told me to meet her there. That's cabana six?

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Cabana one.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: One.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Would you be caring for something to eat or drink, sir?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I would, actually.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Charged to the Underhills, sir?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Right. Tell you what -- have you caviar?

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Yes, sir. Beluga. But it is eighty dollars the portion.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'd better only get two. How about the lobster thermidor?

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: I recommend it.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Fine. And a couple of bottles of Dom Perignon. To cabana one.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Very good, sir.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: You want I set up?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: No thanks, I'll do it. Give yourself twenty dollars. Underhill.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Muchas gracias.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Sierra del fuego.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Your call is come through.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Far out.  Larry? It's Fletch.  Well, it's not 'Fat Sam's', but... any port in a storm.  Oh, tell Frank I need a couple of months. The fifty grand's lasting longer than I thought.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Excuse me. I have something I'd like to discuss with you.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: The door was unlocked.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Lock's busted.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: No wonder.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I work for the landlord. He told me to watch out for the place.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I commend him on his choice.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I commend him on his choice

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I was supposed to meet Mrs. Cavanaugh.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Don Corleone. I'm a cousin of Mrs. Cavanaugh's.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Moved out.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: She moved out?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I spoke to her last week. She didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: She moved out.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: So you're saying she moved out.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: This morning.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: This morning? Christ. We had so much to talk about. Moe Green is out of the Tropicana, and my sons, Michael and Fredo, are taking over.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What did you want under the bed?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Mattress police. There are no tags on the mattress. I'm going to have to take you downtown. Please give me your weapon.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm calling the cops. This is for the cops.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'm her cousin.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Tell the cops.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Go ahead. Call them. Better tie your shoelaces first.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Fletch.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Frank, you look a little peaked. Wanna vomit?

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: No, I want an answer, Is the story done?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Uh, almost.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: 'Uh, almost' is not an answer. 'Yes Frank, it's all done': that's an answer.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: And a damn fine one, I might add.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Two...

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Irwin...

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Oh, I hate it when he calls me that.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Irwin, professional journalism time, now. Go back to the goddamn beach and finish the goddamn story!

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I will, Frank, I will. Something came up, okay?

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: No it's not okay. You have to have this in by tomorrow. Did you see the ad we ran Sunday?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I never read the paper.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: ...never reads the paper...

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: What's the spread on the game tonight?

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: I don't know.  Look!

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Looks great.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Now, Irwin, try to follow me. You can't run the ad and then not run the story.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Why not? Oh shit... really?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Just kidding, Frank. You'll have the story and you'll be damn proud of it.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: You broke it? You know the source?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Practically.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: What's 'practically'? Is it Fat Sam? You said you had pictures of him....

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I have pictures of him. Dealing...

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: So let's go! We run the pictures.

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: He's not the story! There's a source behind him.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Well, there we're in a gray area.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: How gray?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: I'd say charcoal.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: I'm going to bite out your eyeballs, you know that?

turns.speaker: FLETCH
turns.text: Frank, you animal, I love it. I'll have the story by Thursday night, I swear to God.  I hope.
